main event: Multiple sightings of an unidentified flying object (UFO) were reported in Michigan on 24 November 1951, involving military and civilian observers from various locations.
interesting points: Multiple observers reported a large, elongated, cigar-shaped object with a red trail, estimated to be at an altitude of 4,000 to 4,220 feet and traveling at a speed over 400 mph.
An airline pilot reported seeing a similar object over Coopersville, Michigan, estimated to be at an altitude of 1,000 to 1,500 feet and traveling at a speed of 1,000 miles per hour.
The UFO was observed from various locations, including Selfridge Air Force Base, Battle Creek, Grand Rapids, and Coopersville, by military personnel, tower operators, and airline crew.
The object was described as being oval, round, or matchstick-shaped, with a bright white glow and a faint glow at its tail, and it made no sound during the sighting.
The behavior of the UFO, its maneuvering capability, and the absence of a conventional explanation led to the conclusion that the object remained unidentified and unexplained.
sighted object: an elongated, cigar-shaped object with a red trail and a bright white glow
witnesses: military personnel, tower operators, airline crew, and civilians
photographs: no photographs were included in the report
